slide_0.title: Now you will have to pass a Test
slide_0.content: You must answer 17 from 20 questions in order to get the certificate. Please click next slide to start

slide_1.title: If you notice a danger to your health and safety, what should you do?
slide_1.answer: a. Report it to your manager or employer
bullets: a. Leave it alone so as not to cause yourself harm
b. Do whatever’s needed to remove the danger
c. Report it to your manager or employer

slide_2.title: If you identify a frayed cable on an appliance, what should you do?
slide_2.answer: c. Stop using the appliance, remove it from use, and report it straight away to your manager/employer
bullets: a. Repair the frayed cable with tape and continue to use it
b. Attempt to repair the cable yourself
c. Stop using the appliance, remove it from use, and report it straight away to your manager/employer

slide_3.title: Who is responsible for providing protective work clothing?
bullets: a. The local authority
b. The HSA
c. Your employer

slide_4.title: When carrying a heavy or unbalanced object, what should you do?
slide_4.answer: c. Place the heaviest side closest to your body
bullets: a. Transport the object as quickly as possible
b. Bend to pick the object using your knees only
c. Place the heaviest side closest to your body

slide_5.title: When sitting in a desk chair, how should your legs and feet be positioned?
slide_5.answer: c. With your knees at a 90-degree angle and feet flat on the floor
bullets: a. With your knees higher than your hips and feet off the floor
b. With your knees at a 90-degree angle and the feet off the floor
c. With your knees at a 90-degree angle and feet flat on the floor

slide_6.title: Which of these is a source of fuel for a fire?
bullets: a. Oxygen in the air
b. Electric heaters
c. Waste paper and packaging

slide_7.title: Hazardous substances, such as cleaning chemicals, can cause:
bullets: a. Musculoskeletal disorders (MSDs)
b. Repetitive strain injuries
c. Itchy rashes or dermatitis

slide_8.title: When is it most appropriate to use a ladder?
bullets: a. For long-duration tasks
b. For short duration tasks
c. When a height is inaccessible by standing on something else

slide_9.title: To prevent discomfort, your computer screen should be positioned:
slide_9.answer: b. Roughly an arm’s length away from you
bullets: a. Well above your eye-line
b. Roughly an arm’s length away from you
c. Exactly a metre away from you

slide_10.title: If you almost injure yourself at work, what should you do?
slide_10.answer: c. Make a record of it in the accident book as a near miss
bullets: a. Nothing, no action is needed
b. Make a record in the accident book as if the injury has occurred
c. Make a record of it in the accident book as a near miss

slide_11.title: What color is a fire alarm call point sign?
bullets: a. Red and Black
b. Blue and White
c. Red and White

slide_12.title: What do Human Hazards relate to?
bullets: a. The behavior of workers
b. The work activity
c. The working environment

slide_13.title: All office workplaces must have:
bullets: a. A nominated paramedic
b. A first Aid Box
c. A defibrillator on-site

slide_14.title: What should you do in the event of a fire in the office?
slide_14.answer: b. Exit the building calmly using the nearest stairwell
bullets: a. Stay at your desk and continue working
b. Exit the building calmly using the nearest stairwell
c. Hide in the restroom until the alarm stops

slide_15.title: What is the purpose of emergency exits in the office?
slide_15.answer: c. They are designated escape routes in case of emergencies
bullets: a. They are decorative elements
b. They are used for smoking breaks
c. They are designated escape routes in case of emergencies

slide_16.title: How often should you inspect and test office fire extinguishers?
slide_16.answer: c. Monthly, as part of routine checks
bullets: a. Once a year
b. Every 5 years
c. Monthly, as part of routine checks

slide_17.title: In case of a power outage, what should you do to avoid accidents in the office?
slide_17.answer: c. Use a flashlight and follow established safety procedures
bullets: a. Use candles for lighting
b. Stay at your desk until the power is restored
c. Use a flashlight and follow established safety procedures

slide_18.title: What should you do if you discover a spilled liquid on the office floor?
slide_18.answer: c. Report it to the maintenance team
bullets: a. Ignore it
b. Walk around it
c. Report it to the maintenance team

slide_19.title: When using a computer for an extended period, what can help prevent eye strain?
slide_19.answer: b. Taking short breaks and looking away
bullets: a. Staring at the screen continuously
b. Taking short breaks and looking away
c. Lowering the screen brightness

slide_20.title: What is the correct way to handle confidential documents when not in use?
slide_20.answer: c. Shred or store them securely
bullets: a. Leave them on your desk
b. Throw them in the regular trash bin
c. Shred or store them securely
